commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed Duke.java to Connor.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Current project is not personalised.

Project will henceforth proceed with Connor as the chatbot's name.

* program now greets the user before asking for inputs
* program now echoes user inputs
* program recognizes a "bye" command by turning it into uppercase and exits the program

Current program fulfills Level-1.

Let's ,
* Implement a logo

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Switch and Enums to handle commands better
commitResults.messageBody:
Current structure was too messy

Anticipate future commands to be added

Changed:
* added Enums to track valid commands (Hi, add, list, bye).
* catch IllegalArgumentException to handle invalid commands
* added TaskList.java to abstract the list management away from Connor.java.
* TaskList.java utilises LinkedList to store tasks.

Let's
* add more commands

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug fixes to "add" command in Connor.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Current "add" command adds the whole input ("add do work") instead of ("do work") to list.

Bug has been fixed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Mark/Unmark function + further encapsulation for responses
commitResults.messageBody:
The printing of messages could be further simplified to a function.

* Encapsulated the printing function to make code look neater using a separate Response.java.

Added Mark/Unmark for Level-3 using a new Task.java to encapsulate a task.

Lets's
* add TODO, Events, deadlines
* delete function

commitResults.messageTitle: Minor formatting fixes and visual improvements
commitResults.messageBody: Fixed the formatting and naming of certain classes to better reflect their use.

commitResults.messageTitle: Removed Enum and tweaks to compensate for removal
commitResults.messageBody:
Enum did not felt right from a future proofing standpoint.

Remove Enum, hence:
* Tweaked Connor.java to be if-else instead
* Added TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT to replace "ADD" command

TODO, DEADLINE and EVENT extends TASK

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Automated TextUITesting capability
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently Automated TextUITesting was not enabled

Added sample commands to test if output is producing as expected.

Let's continue to update the test everytime a new command is added.

commitResults.messageTitle: Line separator format change
commitResults.messageBody: Changed line separator format from CRLF to LF.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Exceptions handling for invalid commands and tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Current situation: Possiblility of errors with invalid inputs

A valid input is:
* TODO: always valid
* DEADLINE: "/by" is present
* EVENT: "/from" and "/to" is present

Logic and naming functions in Connor has been changed to better reflect their function and purpose.

Let's
* handle all possible errors from now on
* Add more exceptions

commitResults.messageTitle: Added support for deleting tasks from list
commitResults.messageBody:
Current situation: No command to delete task from list

Delete has been implemented by using remove() in the linkedlist library

Noticed a possible bug with exception handling, allowing " " to be considered as valid taskName.

Let's fix the above bug

commitResults.messageTitle: Fixed bugs with regards to exception handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Current situation: invalid commands were not being detected

Commands that are now detected as invalid:
* "todo "
* "event "
* "deadline "

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstracted logic for subclasses of task into a factory class
commitResults.messageBody:
Abstracted logic (to instantiate a TODO,DEADLINE,EVENT) into a separate factory class.

Made Task an abstract class to better adhere to OOP principles

commitResults.messageTitle: Style fixes
commitResults.messageBody: Style fixes to better adhere to style conventions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added exception handling for delete
commitResults.messageBody:
Current situation: User was able to input a value larger than the number of tasks to delete, causing an index out of bounds error.

Added an if statement to check if the value added is invalid.

Updated automatic UI testing to test fro this case.

commitResults.messageTitle: Renaming class files to better adhere to style convention
commitResults.messageBody:
* TODO has been renamed to Todo.
* Response has been renamed to Responses.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added support to save/read from a .txt file
commitResults.messageBody:
Current situation: code only reads input and has no way to store info.

Added the ability to read from /data/Connor.txt. This meant that data is shared among sessions so it functions like a bot.

Changes:
* overloaded instructors for tasks (and subclasses) to make reading from memory cleaner.
* Bug fixes to delete command to now handle invalid deletes.
* Added a delete all function to assist automated testing better.

Let's fix Connor.txt from being created twice separately (due to batch script).

commitResults.messageTitle: Added support for Date and time
commitResults.messageBody:
Current situation: Date and time are strings and have no interactions

Added support to make date/year/time interactable, for future use to do sorting and other functions.

Input is assumed to be valid (2020-05-05 1800).

Let's:
* handle the cases like "2020-5-5"
* update automated test.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fixing merge error
commitResults.messageBody:
Current situation: merged master into branch causing the code to break.

Fixed merge error, code should now function as intended.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Enum to ensure only valid commands are used
commitResults.messageBody:
Added Enums with valid commands to ensure only valid commands get parsed.

Let's
* refactor the exceptions; InvalidCommandException may no longer be needed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Changed the indentation style of switch statement to fit convention
commitResults.messageBody: Updated style convention of switch statement to better adhere to style guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: Removed unused InvalidCommandException
commitResults.messageBody: InvalidCommandException is no longer caught as IllegalArgumentException fufills this purpose.
